program description: Program Description Program OverviewGeorge Brown College's English for Professional Success Certificate will help you develop the skills you need to succeed in Canada's highly competitive and often challenging workplace. By further developing your verbal, listening, and written communication skills, this part-time program will help you build confidence in personal and professional cross-cultural linguistic interactions. Apply to this program if you are a non-native speaker with advanced-level English skills.PLEASE NOTE: Classes for this certificate are delivered in person during evenings and weekends to accommodate working professionals.  Full DescriptionGeorge Brown College's English for Professional Success Certificate is a part-time program designed to help you develop the skills you need to succeed in Canada's highly competitive and often challenging workplace.Apply to this program if you are interested in further developing your verbal, listening, and written communication English language skills for both personal and professional use. To complete this certificate, you must complete three core courses and your choice of two electives. About the English for Professional Success Certificate Program:part-time study with classes delivered during evenings and weekendsdesigned for non-native speakers with advanced-level English skillsfor working professionals looking to build confidence with personal and professional cross-cultural communicationscourses can be taken in the order of your personal preference PLEASE NOTE: Information related to courses, including length, dates, times, location, and delivery mode are subject to change without notice.Career & Postgraduate Study Opportunities
admission requirements: Admission RequirementsApply to this program if you are interested in further developing your verbal, listening, and written communication English language skills for both personal and professional use.As this is an advanced-level certificate, you must complete ESL 9068 (ESL IIIB ADVANCED) or have an equivalent English placement test result prior to taking the core courses in this certificate.Prior to enrolling in any of the elective courses, you must complete the ESL 9067 (ESL IIIA LOW ADVANCED) or have the equivalent English placement test.Special RequirementsYou must achieve a grade of B (73%) or better to successfully complete each course.To achieve this advanced-level certificate, you must complete three core courses and your choice of two electives.Placement TestIf you are writing the level placement test for program entry, please visit Continuing Education (part–time) ESL Program Placement Test Registration to sign up for the test after you have registered for the program.How to ApplyDomestic and International Students:To apply for the program, please visit the Courses section and register directly in your respective course(s) by following the instructions provided.International Students of R902 program:You DO NOT need to apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.
